segments.description: Growing up in Alabama; early observations of racism; starting to practice law
Becoming Attorney General in 1970; dismissal of cases obstructing enforcement of civil rights
Breaking the color line by hiring black attorneys
Beginning of 16th Street Baptist Church bombing investigation; early focus on suspect J.B. Stoner
Friction with the FBI over access to their investigation files
Decision to indict Robert Chambliss; indictment of J.B. Stoner; Doug Jones' indictment of Thomas Blanton and Bobby Cherry
